intro: Monelasmum monticola, commonly known as the mountain monelasmum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and red. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Monelasmum monticola is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats at higher elevations.
